newsitem.title: UGANDA: Uganda expected to export 78,000 tonnes of cotton.
newsitem.headline: Uganda expected to export 78,000 tonnes of cotton.

text.p: Uganda will produce 100,000 tonnes of cotton in 1996/97, of which 78,000 will be exported, the Cotton Development Organisation (CDO) said on Tuesday.
The export total represents a more than seven-fold increase over the 9,385 tonnes exported out of the 1995/96 production total of 10,436, the CDO said.

The World Bank injected $31 million for cotton development in Uganda over a five-year period from 1994 after liberalisation through the International Development Agency, the International Fund for Agricultural Development and the Ugandan government.
Uganda reached peak cotton production in 1969/70 when it recorded a total of 86,385 tonnes of lint, of which 80,639 were exported.
In 1987/88, following the rule of Idi Amin and Milton Obote, production dropped to 2,160 tonnes, of which 887 were exported.
